question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration purposes. The generated hexagrams should include all 64 hexagrams, not just the eight basic ones. Each hexagram should have detailed explanatory texts and interpretations. The analysis needs to be more comprehensive, addressing the specific question being asked, providing detailed insights and definitive answers based on my requirements. Please regenerate the code accordingly.

checklist.title: Are all 64 I Ching hexagrams properly implemented and displayed?
checklist.description: Check if the implementation includes all 64 hexagrams with their proper binary representation, traditional names and numbers. Each hexagram should be visually distinct with clear representation of broken and unbroken lines. Deduct 10 points if fewer than 64 hexagrams are implemented, 5 points if the visual representation is unclear or inaccurate.

checklist.title: Is the hexagram generation algorithm correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the algorithm for generating hexagrams follows traditional I Ching principles (either yarrow stalk or coin toss methods). The algorithm should account for changing lines and properly transform between hexagrams. Deduct 5 points if only one method is implemented, 10 points if the transformation logic contains errors in calculating changing lines.

checklist.title: Does each hexagram include comprehensive interpretation texts?
checklist.description: Verify that each hexagram has detailed textual interpretations including: overall judgment, image text, line-by-line interpretations, and changing line meanings. The texts should be accurate to traditional I Ching sources. Give 0 points if interpretations are missing, 5 points if only basic interpretations are provided, and 10 points for comprehensive texts that include all traditional elements.

checklist.title: Is there a question analysis mechanism that correlates hexagrams with user queries?
checklist.description: Check if the code includes functionality to analyze specific user questions and provide relevant interpretations based on the generated hexagram. The system should establish meaningful connections between the question context and the hexagram's symbolic meaning. Deduct 5 points if the system only provides generic readings without relating to specific questions, and 10 points if there's no question analysis at all.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code handles edge cases such as invalid inputs, unexpected user interactions, and provides appropriate error handling. Test with boundary inputs like empty questions or special characters. Code with strong robustness should gracefully handle these cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Visual animations for coin/yarrow casting 2. Historical context for each hexagram 3. Related hexagrams visualization). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar divination methods 2. Function modules unrelated to I Ching divination 3. Excessive visualizations that distract from the core readings. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating hexagram generation/interpretation/display logic), reusable components, and code maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no clear organization of hexagram data and interpretation texts. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the visual design follows traditional Chinese aesthetics while maintaining modern usability: 1) Appropriate use of traditional colors and symbols 2) Clear visual hierarchy for hexagram display 3) Professional typography with readable Chinese characters when applicable. Deduct 3 points for each cluttered visual element, 5 points for inappropriate color schemes that don't respect the I Ching tradition, and 5 points for poor typography making interpretations difficult to read. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and intuitive?
checklist.description: Judge whether the interaction design follows natural divination processes: 1) Clear visualization of the divination process 2) Intuitive transition from question to hexagram generation to interpretation 3) Accessible navigation between different parts of the reading. Deduct 5 points if the divination process isn't visually represented, 3 points for confusing transitions between steps, and 5 points if interpretations are difficult to navigate or understand. The full score is 10 points.
